item.title: Report E-2024080427
item.description:
Report E-2024080427

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-01
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 1, 2024, four (4) 5-gallon pails of UN1139 were damaged in transit due to no dunnage and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior, loading dock floor, and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized a plug and patch kit to patch the damaged pails. Crews collected the damaged pails for disposal. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and worked them in with hand tools. All impacted material was containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2024080331
item.description:
Report E-2024080331

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-15T15:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 30, 2024, one (1) 2.5 gallon jug of UN1760 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel overpacked the damaged jug into one (1) 55-gallon drum, then deployed absorbents to the impacted dock floor. The crew collected the spent absorbents into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.
